headline: Lennar price target lowered to $110 from $124 at BofA
summary: BofA lowered the firm’s price target on Lennar (LEN) to $110 from $124 and keeps a Neutral rating on the shares. The firm is lowering its price targets for Homebuilders under its coverage to reflect softer demand and elevated incentives, the analyst tells investors. Additionally, the firm expects the challenging environment for homebuilders to continue into the second half of 2025. Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, market-moving breaking financial news. Try Now>> See

headline: America's largest homebuilder warns of slow spring selling season as affordability, confidence weigh on buyers
summary: America's largest homebuilder on Thursday detailed some of the big challenges facing the housing industry this spring selling season and over the balance of the year.

headline: Bear of the Day: Lennar Corporation (LEN)
summary: LEN has tanked roughly 45% from its September highs as its earnings estimates plummet amid a slowing housing market and persistent inflation across many critical aspects of its business.
